item.title: Robyn add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "Yes, frosting. The final defense of the dying." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Robyn add a quote by Yann Martel
item.description: "These people fail to realize that it is on the inside that God must be defended, not on the outside. They should direct their anger at themselves. For evil in the open is but evil from within that has been let out. The main battlefield for good is not the open ground of the public arena but the small clearing of each heart." -- Yann Martel

item.title: Robyn add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "I don't want to lose the boy with the bread." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Robyn add a quote by Yann Martel
item.description: "It's important in life to conclude things properly. Only then can you let go. Otherwise you are left with words you should have said but never did, and your heart is heavy with remorse." -- Yann Martel

item.title: Robyn add a quote by Kathryn Stockett
item.description: "You is kind. You is smart. You is important." -- Kathryn Stockett

item.title: Robyn add a quote by Scott Westerfeld
item.description: "Perhaps the logical conclusion of everyone looking the same is everyone thinking the same." -- Scott Westerfeld

item.title: Robyn add a quote by Yann Martel
item.description: "If you stumble about believability, what are you living for? Love is hard to believe, ask any lover. Life is hard to believe, ask any scientist. God is hard to believe, ask any believer. What is your problem with hard to believe?" -- Yann Martel

item.title: Robyn add a quote by Kathryn Stockett
item.description: "Ever morning, until you dead in the ground, you gone have to make this decision. You gone have to ask yourself, "Am I gone believe what them fools say about me today?" -- Kathryn Stockett

item.title: Robyn add a quote by Yann Martel
item.description: "If Christ spent an anguished night in prayer, if He burst out from the Cross, 'My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?' then surely we are also permitted doubt. But we must move on. To choose doubt as a philosophy of life is akin to choosing immobility as a means of transportation." -- Yann Martel

item.title: Robyn add a quote by Yann Martel
item.description: "I know zoos are no longer in people's good graces. Religion faces the same problem. Certain illusions about freedom plague them both." -- Yann Martel

item.title: Robyn add a quote by Kathryn Stockett
item.description: "Wasn't that the point of the book? For women to realize, We are just two people. Not that much separates us. Not nearly as much as I'd thought." -- Kathryn Stockett

item.title: Robyn add a quote by Kathryn Stockett
item.description: "...and that's when I get to wondering, what would happen if I told her she something good, ever day?" -- Kathryn Stockett

item.title: Robyn add a quote by Kathryn Stockett
item.description: "All I'm saying is, kindness don't have no boundaries." -- Kathryn Stockett

item.title: Robyn add a quote by Kathryn Stockett
item.description: "Ugly live up on the inside. Ugly be a hurtful, mean person." -- Kathryn Stockett

item.title: Robyn add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "Happy Hunger Games! And may the odds be ever in your favor." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Robyn add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "You know, you could live a thousand lifetimes and not deserve him." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Robyn add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description: "Just remember that the things you put into your head are there forever, he said. You might want to think about that. You forget some things, dont you? Yes. You forget what you want to remember and you remember what you want to forget." -- Cormac McCarthy

item.title: Robyn add a quote by Scott Westerfeld
item.description: "We're not freaks, Tally. We're normal. We may not be gorgeous, but at least we're not hyped-up Barbie dolls." -- Scott Westerfeld

item.title: Robyn add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "And, when you want something, all the universe conspires in helping you to achieve it." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Robyn add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "There is only one thing that makes a dream impossible to achieve: the fear of failure." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Robyn add a quote by Christopher Moore
item.description: "Stephenie Meyer: Her vampires are sparkly, which I think we can all agree is wrong." -- Christopher Moore

item.title: Robyn add a quote by Mary Ann Shaffer
item.description: "Reading good books ruins you for enjoying bad books." -- Mary Ann Shaffer

item.title: Robyn add a quote by Mary Ann Shaffer
item.description: "That's what I love about reading: one tiny thing will interest you in a book, and that tiny thing will lead you to another book, and another bit there will lead you onto a third book. It's geometrically progressive - all with no end in sight, and for no other reason than sheer enjoyment." -- Mary Ann Shaffer

item.title: Robyn add a quote by Mary Ann Shaffer
item.description: "Have you ever noticed that when your mind is awakened or drawn to someone new, that person's name suddenly pops up everywhere you go? My friend Sophie calls it coincidence, and Mr. Simpless, my parson friend, calls it Grace. He thinks that if one cares deeply about someone or something new one throws a kind of energy out into the world, and "fruitfulness" is drawn in. " -- Mary Ann Shaffer

item.title: Robyn add a quote by Mary Ann Shaffer & Annie Barrows
item.description: "I am to cover the philosophical side of the debate and so far my only thought is that reading keeps you from going gaga." -- Mary Ann Shaffer & Annie Barrows

item.title: Robyn add a quote by Mary Ann Shaffer
item.description: "All my life I thought that the story was over when the hero and heroine were safely engaged -- after all, what's good enough for Jane Austen ought to be good enough for anyone. But it's a lie. The story is about to begin, and every day will be a new piece of the plot. " -- Mary Ann Shaffer

item.title: Robyn add a quote by Mary Ann Shaffer
item.description: "After all, what's good enough for Austen ought to be good enough for anyone." -- Mary Ann Shaffer

item.title: Robyn add a quote by Mary Ann Shaffer
item.description: "The first rule of snooping is to come at it sideways." -- Mary Ann Shaffer

item.title: Robyn add a quote by Christopher Moore
item.description: "Only by being prepared for your death can you ever truly live. " -- Christopher Moore

item.title: Robyn add a quote by Christopher Moore
item.description: "It was watching Madeline Alby eat cheese with every ounce of her being, like it was the first and best time, that made him realize that he had never really tasted cheese, or crackers, or life. And he didn't want his daughter to live that way. He'd moved her into her own room the night before...He hadn't slept well, and had gotten up five times during the night to check on her, only to find her sleeping peacefully, but he could lose a little sleep if Sophie could go through life without his fears and limitations. He wanted her to experience all the glorious cheese of life." -- Christopher Moore
